benchmark_details.name: ADVQA
benchmark_details.overview: ADVQA is a newly created human-grounded adversarial question answering dataset that utilizes the ADVSCORE metric for evaluating adversarialness, aiming to provide realistic and high-quality adversarial samples to test model robustness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The main objective of ADVQA is to provide a robust evaluation framework for assessing the adversarialness of datasets by incorporating human performance into adversarial question answering tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: ADVQA may become less effective over time as models improve and may require periodic updates.

data.source: Collected through human responses from trivia competitions and crowd-sourced writings.
data.annotation: Questions were curated and edited by expert writers based on human feedback in a competitive setting.

methodology.calculation: ADVSCORE is calculated using item response theory (IRT), evaluating the margin of human vs. model performance and question discriminability.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ADVSCORE values indicate more adversarial and discriminative questions.
methodology.validation: ADVQA's effectiveness is validated against existing adversarial benchmarks like TRICKME and FM2.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participant privacy was protected under an official IRB review, and consent was obtained for using their responses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Consent forms were collected to allow the use of responses for academic purposes.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study complied with ethical standards for human subjects research.
